result.execSummary:
The defendant Justice H. Blackhawk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.
Must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and a driver safety plan.  You must also comply with any recommendations.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.    Any out of pocket costs for the alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan shall be subtracted from the fine and costs in this action, pursuant to sec. 346.65(2e) Wis. Stats.
Maintain employment.  No to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.
May apply for expungement 1 year after successful completion of probation, if he has no new charges referred for prosecution or new convictions.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Write a letter of apology to his mother.  Agent to preapprove.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Defendant may apply for early discharge after 18 months, if agent recommends, and he has all court ordered financial obligations paid in full.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.

timeConds.notes: All but the first 5 days stayed on the condition he complies will all conditions of probation that includes alcohol and other drug treatment.  Sentence to start on or before September 27, 2017 at 6:00 pm.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sherman.  Victim rights notification complied with.  In 16CM97 defendant plead no contest to Count 1, OWI 2nd.  In 17CM4 the defendant plead no contest to Count 1, domestic disorderly conduct. Count 2 in 17CM4 and 16CM97 are dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Prior OWI confirmed by the Court with the defendant and Attorney Sherman.     Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood.  Defendant stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Find guilty of OWI 2nd contrary to 346.63(1)(a) and Domestic Disorderly Conduct, contrary to 947.01(1) and 968.075(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for:  OWI.  2 years probation.  $450  1555.00 fine and costs  Any out of pocket costs for the alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan shall be subtracted from the fine and costs in this action, pursuant to sec. 346.65(2e) Wis. Stats.  10 days jail all but the first 5 days stayed on the condition he comply with all conditions of probation.  Alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan.  12 month DL revocation and IID.  17CM4, concurrent 2 year probation.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  LOA to his mother.  AODA and recommended treatment.   Obtain and maintain employment.  Subject to random testing.  May apply for expungement after 1 year successfully completion of probation if he has no new charges.  Attorney Sherman says 2 years probation is not necessary.  

Court ordered: sentence withheld, 2 years probation on 16CM97.  $1555.00 fine and costs  Any out of pocket costs for the alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan shall be subtracted from the fine and costs in this action, pursuant to sec. 346.65(2e) Wis. Stats.  10 days jail,  all but the first 5 days stayed on the condition he comply with all conditions of probation that includes alcohol and other drug treatment.  Start on or before September 27, 2017 at 6:00 pm.   Alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan.  12 month DL revocation and IID.  In 17CM4, concurrent 2 year probation.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.  Write a LOA to his mother. Agent to preapprove.   AODA and recommended treatment.   Maintain employment.  Not to terminate without his agent's prior approval.  Subject to random testing.  After 18 month, may apply for early discharge if agent recommends.  Must have all costs and fine paid in full.   May apply for expungement after 1 year successfully completion of probation if he has no new charges referred for prosecution, or convictions.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 28, 2017 at 10:00 am.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sherman.  Have an agreement.  Set for plea/sentencing.
State of WI DOJ CIB
State of WI DOJ CIB

Covers 16CM97 and 17CM4.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
